videoSnippet.title: Alireza is in a League of His Own
videoSnippet.description:
Photos by Lennart Ootes
Evans Gambit tutorial by me here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CUQQ4dym5ZU

Have a great day :)

Firouzja, Alireza (2778) - Dominguez Perez, Leinier (2754) 
Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz (chess24.com) [27] 2022.08.30
A36 English, ultra-symmetrical variation

1.c4 c5 2.g3 g6 3.Bg2 Bg7 4.Nc3 Nc6 5.d3 d6 6.Qd2 e6 7.b3 Nge7 8.Bb2 O-O 9.Nf3 d5 10.O-O d4 11.Na4 b6 12.e3 e5 13.exd4 exd4 14.a3 a5 15.Rfe1 Rb8 16.Bc1 h6 17.Qd1 g5 18.Ra2 Bd7 19.h4 g4 20.Nh2 h5 21.f3 Ne5 22.fxg4 hxg4 23.Rae2 f6 24.Re4 Bc6 25.Nxg4 Bxe4 26.Rxe4 Nxg4 27.Rxg4 f5 28.Rg5 Rf6 29.Bf4 Rc8 30.Be5 Rg6 31.Bd5+ Kf8 32.Qh5 Bxe5 33.Rxg6 Nxg6 34.Qxg6 Qc7 35.Nxb6 Rd8 36.Qg8+ Ke7 37.Qf7+

00:00 Hello Everyone!
01:18 Game Starts
03:38 Completely New Game
08:18 Pause THE video!
10:00 It Was in this Position!
11:00 World BLITZ TOP 20
12:00 Standings!
13:45 Contributions!

The Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz is the 4th stage on the 2022 Grand Chess Tour, a series of five events with a total prize fund of $1.4 million. The 10-player event takes place from August 26-31 and has a $40,000 top prize.

The rapid is a single round-robin on the first 3 days with a time control of 25 minutes for all moves and a 10-second increment from move 1. The final 2 days are a blitz double round-robin, with 18 rounds of 5+2 blitz. Rapid games count double, with 2 points for a win and 1 for a draw. Official website: grandchesstour.org

judgment.name: Blunder
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Re8 was best.
